detaileddescription.para: Application only was reset (extend the PSP enumeration here)
Maximum length allowed for CDS name. NOTE: "+2" is for NULL Character and "." (i.e. - "AppName.CDSName")

sectiondef.header: Run Status and Exit Status identifiers

briefdescription.para: Indicates that the Application should continue to run.
Indicates that the Application wants to exit normally.
Indicates that the Application is quitting with an error.
The cFE App caused an exception.
The system is requesting a restart of the cFE App.
The system is requesting a reload of the cFE App.
The system is requesting that the cFE App is stopped.
Indicates that the Core Application could not Init.
Indicates that the Core Application had a runtime failure.

memberdef.name: CFE_ES_DBIT
memberdef.initializer: (1L << (x)) /* Places a one at bit positions 0 thru 31 */

memberdef.name: CFE_ES_DTEST
memberdef.initializer: (((i) & CFE_ES_DBIT(x)) != 0) /* TRUE iff bit x of i is set */

memberdef.name: CFE_ES_TEST_LONG_MASK
memberdef.initializer: (CFE_ES_DTEST(m[(s)/32],(s)%32)) /* Test a bit within an array of 32-bit integers. */

detaileddescription.para: Max number of size divisions allowed in a memory pool

briefdescription.para: Number of cycles that ES will wait before killing an app.
Indicates that the memory pool selection will not use a semaphore.
Indicates that the memory pool selection will use a semaphore.
Entry marker for use with Software Performance Analysis Tool.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This macro logs the entry or start event/marker for the specified entry id. This macro, in conjunction with the CFE_ES_PerfLogExit, is used by the Software Performance Analysis tool (see section 5.15).

parameterdescription.para: Identifier of the specific event or marker.

briefdescription.para: Exit marker for use with Software Performance Analysis Tool.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This macro logs the exit or end event/marker for the specified entry id. This macro, in conjunction with the CFE_ES_PerfLogEntry, is used by the Software Performance Analysis tool (see section 5.15).

parameterdescription.para: Identifier of the specific event or marker.

briefdescription.para: Data type used to hold Handles of Memory Pools created via CFE_ES_PoolCreate and CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem.
Data type used to hold Handles of Critical Data Stores. See CFE_ES_RegisterCDS.
Required Prototype of Child Task Main Functions.
Required Prototype of Library Initialization Functions.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 StartType, uint32 StartSubtype, uint32 ModeId, const char *StartFilePath)
memberdef.name: CFE_ES_Main

briefdescription.para: cFE Main Entry Point used by Board Support Package to start cFE

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: cFE main entry point. This is the entry point into the cFE software. It is called only by the Board Support Package software.

parameterdescription.para: Identifies whether this was a #CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_POWERON or #CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_PROCESSOR.
Specifies, in more detail, what caused the StartType identified above. See CFE_ES_POWER_CYCLE for possible examples.
Identifies the source of the Boot as determined by the BSP.
Identifies the startup file to use to initialize the cFE apps.

briefdescription.para: Return the most recent Reset Type.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Provides the caller with codes that identifies the type of Reset the processor most recently underwent. The caller can also obtain information on what caused the reset by supplying a pointer to a variable that will be filled with the Reset Sub-Type.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to uint32 type variable in which the Reset Sub-Type will be stored. The caller can set this pointer to NULL if the Sub-Type is of no interest.
If the provided pointer was not NULL, the Reset Sub-Type is stored at the given address. For a list of possible Sub-Type values, see "Reset Sub-Types" .

entry.para: #CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_POWERON
#CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_PROCESSOR

briefdescription.para: Reset the cFE Core and all cFE Applications.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API causes an immediate reset of the cFE Kernel and all cFE Applications. The caller can specify whether the reset should clear all memory (#CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_POWERON) or try to retain volatile memory areas (#CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_PROCESSOR).

parameterdescription.para:
Identifies the type of reset desired. Allowable settings are:
#CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_POWERON - Causes all memory to be cleared
#CFE_PSP_RST_TYPE_PROCESSOR - Attempts to retain volatile disk, critical data store and user reserved memory.

entry.para: Bad parameter passed into an ES API.

Current version of cFE does not have the function or the feature of the function implemented. This could be due to either an early build of the cFE for this platform or the platform does not support the specified feature.

briefdescription.para: Restart a single cFE Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API causes a cFE Application to be stopped and restarted.

parameterdescription.para: Identifies the application to be reset.

entry.para: Current version of cFE does not have the function or the feature of the function implemented. This could be due to either an early build of the cFE for this platform or the platform does not support the specified feature.

briefdescription.para: Reload a single cFE Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API causes a cFE Application to be stopped and restarted from the specified file.

parameterdescription.para: Identifies the application to be reset.
Identifies the new file to start.

entry.para: Current version of cFE does not have the function or the feature of the function implemented. This could be due to either an early build of the cFE for this platform or the platform does not support the specified feature.

briefdescription.para: Delete a cFE Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API causes a cFE Application to be stopped deleted.

parameterdescription.para: Identifies the application to be reset.

entry.para: Current version of cFE does not have the function or the feature of the function implemented. This could be due to either an early build of the cFE for this platform or the platform does not support the specified feature.

briefdescription.para: Exit a cFE Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API is the "Exit Point" for the cFE application

entry.para: Current version of cFE does not have the function or the feature of the function implemented. This could be due to either an early build of the cFE for this platform or the platform does not support the specified feature.

briefdescription.para: Check for Exit, Restart, or Reload commands.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This is the API that allows an app to check for exit requests from the system.

parameterdescription.para:
A pointer to a variable containing the Application's desired run status. Acceptable values are:
CFE_ES_APP_RUN -
CFE_ES_APP_EXIT -
CFE_ES_APP_ERROR -

entry.para: The application should continue executing
The application should terminate itself

briefdescription.para: Allow an Application to Wait for others to start up.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This is the API that allows an app to wait for the "rest" of the apps to finish initializing before continuing. It is most useful for applications such as Health and Safety or the Scheduler that need to wait until applications exist and are running before sending out packets to them.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: This API should only be called as the last item of an Apps initialization. In addition, this API should only be called by an App that is started from the ES Startup file. It should not be used by an App that is started after the system is running. ( Although it will cause no harm )

parameterdescription.para: The timeout value in Milliseconds. This parameter must be at least 1000. Lower values will be rounded up. There is not an option to wait indefinitely to avoid hanging a critical application because a non-critical app did not start.

briefdescription.para: Registers a cFE Application with the Executive Services.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This API registers the calling Application with the cFE.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: NOTE: This function MUST be called before any other cFE API functions are called.

entry.para: Return codes from OS_TaskRegister
Return codes from OS_BinSemTake
Operation was performed successfully

briefdescription.para: Get an Application ID for the calling Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine retrieves the cFE Application ID for the calling Application.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: NOTE: All tasks associated with the Application would return the same Application ID.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to variable that is to receive the Application's ID.
Application ID of the calling Application.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
The given application ID does not reflect a currently active application.
Invalid pointer argument (NULL)

briefdescription.para: Get an Application ID associated with a specified Application name.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine retrieves the cFE Application ID associated with a specified Application name.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to variable that is to receive the Application's ID.
Pointer to null terminated character string containing an Application name.
Application ID of the calling Application.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
There is no match for the given application name in the current application list.
Invalid pointer argument (NULL)

briefdescription.para: Get an Application name for a specified Application ID.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine retrieves the cFE Application ID associated with a specified Application name.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a character array of at least BufferLength in size that will be filled with the appropriate Application name.
Application ID of Application whose name is being requested.
The maximum number of characters, including the null terminator, that can be put into the AppName buffer. This routine will truncate the name to this length, if necessary.
Null terminated Application name of the Application associated with the specified Application ID.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
The given application ID does not reflect a currently active application.
Invalid pointer argument (NULL)

briefdescription.para: Get Application Information given a specified App ID.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine retrieves the information about an App associated with a specified App ID. The information includes all of the information ES maintains for an application ( documented in the CFE_ES_AppInfo_t type )

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a CFE_ES_AppInfo_t structure that holds the specific Application information.
Application ID of Application whose name is being requested.
Filled out CFE_ES_AppInfo_t structure containing the App Name, and application memory addresses among other fields.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
The given application ID does not reflect a currently active application.
Invalid pointer argument (NULL)

briefdescription.para: Get Task Information given a specified Task ID.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine retrieves the information about a Task associated with a specified Task ID. The information includes Task Name, and Parent/Creator Application ID.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a CFE_ES_TaskInfo_t structure that holds the specific task information.
Application ID of Application whose name is being requested.
Filled out CFE_ES_TaskInfo_t structure containing the Task Name, Parent App Name, Parent App ID among other fields.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Occurs when the Task ID passed into CFE_ES_GetTaskInfo is invalid.
Invalid pointer argument (NULL)

briefdescription.para: Registers a cFE Child task associated with a cFE Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine registers a cFE Child task and associates it with its parent cFE Application.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: NOTE: This API MUST be called by the Child Task before any other cFE API calls are made.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Errors occured when trying to register a child task.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32 *TaskIdPtr, const char *TaskName, CFE_ES_ChildTaskMainFuncPtr_t FunctionPtr, uint32 *StackPtr, uint32 StackSize, uint32 Priority, uint32 Flags)
memberdef.name: CFE_ES_CreateChildTask

briefdescription.para: Creates a new task under an existing Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine creates a new task (a separate execution thread) owned by the calling Application.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a variable that will be filled in with the new task's ID.
A pointer to a string containing the desired name of the new task. This can be up to #OS_MAX_API_NAME characters, including the trailing null.
A pointer to the function that will be spawned as a new task. This function must have the following signature: uint32 function(void). Input parameters for the new task are not supported.
A pointer to the location where the child task's stack pointer should start. NOTE: Not all underlying operating systems support this parameter.
The number of bytes to allocate for the new task's stack.
The priority for the new task. Lower numbers are higher priority, with 0 being the highest priority. Applications cannot create tasks with a higher priority (lower number) than their own priority.
Reserved for future expansion.
The Task ID of the newly created child task.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
There was an error creating a child task.

briefdescription.para: Deletes a task under an existing Application.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine deletes a task under an Application specified by the TaskId obtained when the child task was created using the CFE_ES_CreateChildTask API.

parameterdescription.para: The task ID previously obtained when the Child Task was created with the CFE_ES_CreateChildTask API.

entry.para: Current version of cFE does not have the function or the feature of the function implemented. This could be due to either an early build of the cFE for this platform or the platform does not support the specified feature.

briefdescription.para: Exits a child task.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine allows the current executing child task to exit and be deleted by ES.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: This function cannot be called from an Application's Main Task.

entry.para: This function does not return a value, but if it does return at all, it is assumed that the Task was either unregistered or this function was called from a cFE Application's main task.

briefdescription.para: Increments the execution counter for the calling task.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine increments the execution counter that is stored for the calling task. It can be called from cFE Application main tasks, child tasks, or cFE Core application main tasks. Normally, the call is not necessary from a cFE Application, since the CFE_ES_RunLoop call increments the counter for the Application.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: NOTE: This API is not needed for Appplications that call the CFE_ES_RunLoop call.

entry.para: This function does not return a value.

briefdescription.para: Write a string to the cFE System Log.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine writes a formatted string to the cFE system log. This can be used to record very low-level errors that can't be reported using the Event Services. This function is used in place of printf for flight software. It should be used for significant startup events, critical errors, and conditionally compiled debug software.

parameterdescription.para: The format string for the log message. This is similar to the format string for a printf() call.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
The cFE system Log is full.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *DataPtr, uint32 DataLength, uint32 InputCRC, uint32 TypeCRC)
memberdef.name: CFE_ES_CalculateCRC

briefdescription.para: Calculate a CRC on a block of memory.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine calculates a cyclic redundancy check (CRC) on a block of memory. The CRC algorithm used is determined by the last parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the base of the memory block.
The number of bytes in the memory block.
A starting value for use in the CRC calculation. This parameter allows the user to calculate the CRC of non-contiguous blocks as a single value. Nominally, the user should set this value to zero.
One of the following CRC algorithm selections: \arg \c CFE_ES_CRC_8 - (Not currently implemented) \arg \c CFE_ES_CRC_16 - a CRC-16 algorithm \arg \c CFE_ES_CRC_32 - (not currently implemented)

entry.para: The result of the CRC calculation on the specified memory block.

briefdescription.para: Reserve space (or re-obtain previously reserved space) in the Critical Data Store (CDS)

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine allocates a block of memory in the Critical Data Store and associates it with the calling Application. The memory can survive an Application restart as well as a Processor Reset.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Application's variable that will contain the CDS Memory Block Handle.
The number of bytes needed in the CDS.
A pointer to a character string containing an application unique name of CFE_ES_CDS_MAX_NAME_LENGTH characters or less.
The handle of the CDS block that can be used in CFE_ES_CopyToCDS and CFE_ES_RestoreFromCDS.

entry.para: The memory block was successfully created in the CDS.
The processor does not support a Critical Data Store.
The Application is receiving the pointer to a CDS that was already present.
The Application is requesting a CDS Block with a size of zero.
The Application is requesting a CDS Block with an invalid ASCII string name. Either the name is too long (> CFE_ES_CDS_MAX_NAME_LENGTH) or was an empty string.
The CDS Registry has as many entries in it as it can hold. The CDS Registry size can be adjusted with the #CFE_ES_CDS_MAX_NUM_ENTRIES macro defined in the cfe_platform_cfg.h file.

briefdescription.para: Save a block of data in the Critical Data Store (CDS)

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine copies a specified block of memory into the Critical Data Store that had been previously registered via CFE_ES_RegisterCDS. The block of memory to be copied must be at least as big as the size specified when registering the CDS.

parameterdescription.para: The handle of the CDS block that was previously obtained from CFE_ES_RegisterCDS.
A Pointer to the block of memory to be copied into the CDS.

entry.para: The Memory Pool handle is invalid.
Problem with handle or a size mismatch

briefdescription.para: Recover a block of data from the Critical Data Store (CDS)

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine copies data from the Critical Data Store identified with the Handle into the area of memory pointed to by the RestoreToMemory pointer. The area of memory to be copied into must be at least as big as the size specified when registering the CDS. The recovery will indicate an error if the data integrity check maintained by the CDS indicates the contents of the CDS have changed. However, the contents will still be copied into the specified area of memory.

parameterdescription.para: The handle of the CDS block that was previously obtained from CFE_ES_RegisterCDS.
A Pointer to the block of memory that is to be restored with the contents of the CDS.
The contents of the specified CDS.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully

Occurs when trying to read a CDS Data block and the CRC of the current data does not match the stored CRC for the data. Either the contents of the CDS Data Block are corrupted or the CDS Control Block is corrupted.
Problem with handle or a size mismatch

briefdescription.para: Initializes a memory pool created by an application without using a semaphore during processing.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine initializes a pool of memory supplied by the calling application. When a memory pool created by this routine is processed, no mutex handling is performed.

listitem.para: The size of the pool must be an integral number of 32-bit words
The start address of the pool must be 32-bit aligned
168 bytes are used for internal bookkeeping, therefore, they will not be available for allocation.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the variable the caller wishes to have the memory pool handle kept in.
A Pointer to the pool of memory created by the calling application. This address must be on a 32-bit boundary.
The size of the pool of memory. Note that this must be an integral number of 32 bit words.
The memory pool handle.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Bad parameter passed into an ES API.

briefdescription.para: Initializes a memory pool created by an application while using a semaphore during processing.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine initializes a pool of memory supplied by the calling application. When a memory pool created by this routine is processed, mutex handling will be performed.

listitem.para: The size of the pool must be an integral number of 32-bit words
The start address of the pool must be 32-bit aligned
168 bytes are used for internal bookkeeping, therefore, they will not be available for allocation.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the variable the caller wishes to have the memory pool handle kept in.
A Pointer to the pool of memory created by the calling application. This address must be on a 32-bit boundary.
The size of the pool of memory. Note that this must be an integral number of 32 bit words.
The memory pool handle.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Bad parameter passed into an ES API.

memberdef.argsstring: (CFE_ES_MemHandle_t *HandlePtr, uint8 *MemPtr, uint32 Size, uint32 NumBlockSizes, uint32 *BlockSizes, uint16 UseMutex)
memberdef.name: CFE_ES_PoolCreateEx

briefdescription.para: Initializes a memory pool created by an application with application specified block sizes.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine initializes a pool of memory supplied by the calling application.

listitem.para: The size of the pool must be an integral number of 32-bit words
The start address of the pool must be 32-bit aligned
168 bytes are used for internal bookkeeping, therefore, they will not be available for allocation.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the variable the caller wishes to have the memory pool handle kept in.
A Pointer to the pool of memory created by the calling application. This address must be on a 32-bit boundary.
The size of the pool of memory. Note that this must be an integral number of 32 bit words.
The number of different block sizes specified in the BlockSizes array. If set equal to zero or if greater than 17, then default block sizes are used.

Pointer to an array of sizes to be used instead of the default block sizes specified by #CFE_ES_MEM_BLOCK_SIZE_01 through #CFE_ES_MAX_BLOCK_SIZE. If the pointer is equal to NULL, the default block sizes are used.
Flag indicating whether the new memory pool will be processing with mutex handling or not. Valid parameter values are CFE_ES_USE_MUTEX and CFE_ES_NO_MUTEX
The memory pool handle.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
Bad parameter passed into an ES API.

briefdescription.para: Gets a buffer from the memory pool created by CFE_ES_PoolCreate or CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine obtains a block of memory from the memory pool supplied by the calling application.

listitem.para: The size allocated from the memory pool is, at a minimum, 12 bytes more than requested.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the Application's pointer in which will be stored the address of the allocated memory buffer.
The handle to the memory pool as returned by CFE_ES_PoolCreate or CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem.
The size of the buffer requested. NOTE: The size allocated may be larger.
The address of the requested buffer.

entry.para: When successful, the return value is a positive number and is the number of bytes actually allocated for the buffer.
The Memory Pool handle is invalid.
The block size requested is invalid.

simplesect.para: CFE_ES_PoolCreate, CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem, CFE_ES_PoolCreateEx, CFE_ES_PutPoolBuf, CFE_ES_GetMemPoolStats, CFE_ES_GetPoolBufInfo

briefdescription.para: Gets info on a buffer previously allocated via CFE_ES_GetPoolBuf.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine gets info on a buffer in the memory pool.

parameterdescription.para: The handle to the memory pool as returned by CFE_ES_PoolCreate or CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem.
A pointer to the memory buffer to provide status for.

entry.para: When successful, the return value is a positive number and is the number of bytes actually allocated.
The Memory Pool handle is invalid.
The specified address is not in the memory pool.

simplesect.para: CFE_ES_PoolCreate, CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem, CFE_ES_PoolCreateEx, CFE_ES_GetPoolBuf, CFE_ES_GetMemPoolStats, CFE_ES_PutPoolBuf

briefdescription.para: Releases a buffer from the memory pool that was previously allocated via CFE_ES_GetPoolBuf.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine releases a buffer back into the memory pool.

parameterdescription.para: The handle to the memory pool as returned by CFE_ES_PoolCreate or CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem.
A pointer to the memory buffer to be released.

entry.para: When successful, the return value is a positive number and is the number of bytes actually released.
The Memory Pool handle is invalid.

simplesect.para: CFE_ES_PoolCreate, CFE_ES_PoolCreateNoSem, CFE_ES_PoolCreateEx, CFE_ES_GetPoolBuf, CFE_ES_GetMemPoolStats, CFE_ES_GetPoolBufInfo

briefdescription.para: Extracts the statistics maintained by the memory pool software.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine fills the CFE_ES_MemPoolStats_t data structure with the statistics maintained by the memory pool software. These statistics can then be telemetered by the calling Application.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to CFE_ES_MemPoolStats_t data structure to be filled with memory statistics.
The handle to the memory pool whose statistics are desired.
Memory Pool Statistics stored in given data structure.

entry.para: Operation was performed successfully
The Memory Pool handle is invalid.

Used to specify Entry(0) or Exit(1)

simplesect.para: This hook routine is called from the PSP when an exception occurs
